If you want to paint, do it when you have less furniture. Empty out the entire room if you can, paint it completely. Then move everything from another room into the painted one, paint the next empty room. Continue shuffling things around until everything is painted. Itâ€™s much easier to move everything out of the room than to try and cover it and paint while having to move yourself around the furniture. If you only have one bathroom be prepared to not shower for at least a day after youâ€™re done painting (and during painting as well) and make absolute sure youâ€™re buying the right type of paint for moist places.

Thereâ€™s a reason CPS doesnâ€™t encourage people to talk to the other party before reporting. Itâ€™s safer for the reporter and also the abused if the abuser is blindsided by it. They have less of a chance to prevent the abused from talking, and they have less of a chance to retaliate against the reporter. Believe me, everyone is safer by the system working this way.

Now, I get it that youâ€™re angry. Itâ€™s a terribly scary and frustrating place to be. Just be honest with the caseworker and everything will be fine. Itâ€™s GOOD that you have unsafe places inaccessible to your child. Itâ€™s fine that you let your kid play in the living room and make a mess in there as kids do. No. Iâ€™ve never wanted kids. From a young age I remember watching my parents struggle with everything and I wondered why they decided to have me (I knew what abortion was by this point and also knew that babies were put up for adoption). Their lives would have been so much easier if they didnâ€™t have me. 

As I got older and things like sexual abuse, depression, anxiety found their way to me I didnâ€™t want kids. I didnâ€™t want to give them a life like mine.. Why would they go through that?â€ 

As I got a little older I was involved with some predatory people and my first instincts were â€œdo whatever it takes to not get pregnantâ€ and luckily I never did. 

Now as my 30th birthday approaches and Iâ€™m living with the love of my life, I couldnâ€™t imagine brining a child into this world. So I have a small wallet, a smallet if you will, and I generally only keep my license and Costco card in there. (I have a larger wallet that I keep in my purse that has all the other wallet stuff in it) Normally I keep my smallet in the console of my car so that anytime I go anywhere I have my ID. Itâ€™s important to note that last fall I moved from my home state to my SOs home state. I waited to change it over to new state because I had a thing on my record in my home state that I was waiting to clear... Anyway I also realized Iâ€™d lost my SS card and you need one to get that newfangled Real ID, so I went down to the closest SS office and waited 4 hours to get a new one sent to my new address. Eventually the new SS card arrived so I immediately put it inside my smallet, you know, so it wouldnâ€™t get lost. Then we left to go somewhere so I put my smallet back in the car like usual. I had both an ID and a drivers license, usually one goes into SO wallet and one into mine but at this point I put both in my smallet to take to the DMV... 

A week or so goes by and we finally have time to go to the DMV. Iâ€™m going around the house collecting proof of address and such and go out to the car to check my smallet. Itâ€™s gone. Now the only people who get into my car are me and SO, so itâ€™s not like some random could have stolen it. I also am very very careful about always locking the car, even in my driveway. SO is too. So I go inside and ask him if heâ€™s seen the smallet incase I brought it inside and forgot. He says he hasnâ€™t seen it. We look everywhere, starting with the places I usually put it (namely the console in the car got checked at least 5 times between us meaning everything was taken out and put back). Itâ€™s nowhere to be found. I find this super frustrating because Iâ€™m the type of person that puts things in one place. Like if my smallet isnâ€™t in the car, itâ€™s in my pocket/purse or itâ€™s on the kitchen counter. (Also super frustrating because itâ€™s a loop of not being able to replace ID without SS card and vice versa) We looked for days and days. I called local PD and all the stores Iâ€™d been to. I posted rewards on fb, here, and Craigslist. Nothing but scammers. Worst part is I donâ€™t really know when I lost it because itâ€™s not like I check everyday to make sure itâ€™s still in the console. So about every other day I check the car again to make sure it didnâ€™t get stuck somewhere and suddenly came loose or something.

One day, after itâ€™s been gone about a month, Iâ€™m driving along and SO reaches into that console to get something and.. pulls out my smallet. I was so relieved I could have cried. But I know for definite sure that it was not in that console after I noticed it missing. Where did it go? Idk but it was there, then gone, and suddenly there again. Everything intact. I went to the DMV two days later, which is good because the next week everything shut down over Covid.
